comments:
At some point after opening some files in the editor (after the first file but
before the 10th) A daialog box appears informing of an error and to check the
.log file.  This (appears) to only happen when opening a file from the Package
Explorer via a "double click" of the mouse.  Opening by right clicking and
selecting open from the context menu works, even after the error.  After the
error double clicking on files from the PAckage Explorer does not open the files
and simply results in more errors in the .log file.

I cannot reproduce this with the 3.0M6 build on gtk 2.0.6 or gtk 2.2.1.  Which 
eclipse build and gtk version are you using?  And does this happen for you 
consistently?  If so, are there any preconditions that aren't in your original 
description?  Thanks...

I am running GTK 2.2.4 under Fedora.  
The Eclipse Build is the M6 (build id 200312182000)
I start Eclipse with this command:
/usr/local/eclipse/eclipse -data /home/robert/workspace/ -vmagrs -Xmx256m

I can produce the problem in one of two ways.

The first and most consistent:
1) Start Eclipse with no editors open (close all editors before closing Eclipse)
2) Open any java file
3) Close that Java file
4) Reopen that java file.
Results: SWTException, Widget is disposed

The secod methdo, less consistent
1) Start Eclipse with no editors open (close all editors before closing Eclipse)
2) Open n editors, 5<n<10
Results: SWTException, Widget is disposed

The third method, a form of method 2
1) Leave n editors open (5<n<10), and close eclipse
2) Start eclipse
3) Open an additional editor
Results: SWTException, Widget is disposed

It works for me too.
Which destop manager and theme are you using ?
What "fedora" means ?

Using gnome as a desktop manager with bluecurve, the default redhat theme and
fedora is the "non-enterprise" falvor distro from redhat
(http://fedora.redhat.com/).
This error persists in the Integration Build I20040129
Does this problem still happen with Eclipse 3.0 ?

Works for me on Fedora Core 3. Eclipse 3.1 RC2.
Please, reopen this problem if it still happen to you.
Note: Try to update from Fedora Core 1 to something more recent. FC1 is not 
too good to run Eclipse.
